blog.name: grey-jedi-enters-the-game
blog.title: Star wars themed trash here
blog.description: Because main blog just can't take all the star wars trash. That's why.

summary: So I've got this idea that not a long time before tfa, there used to be one little (about some cute 4 meters long) dianoga Hux...
body:
There used to be a dianoga aboard the Finalizer

So I’ve got this idea that not a long time before tfa, there used to be one little (about some cute 4 meters long) dianoga Hux didn’t know about on his ship.

The reason for him not being informed was that, as a matter of fact, parasitic life forms such as mynocks and baby exogorths trying to sneak their way into ship duckts and engine exhausts were a daily occurance and crew used to deal with them rutinely, so reports of this kind never reached higher command in any other form than casual budget sumary and ocasional death count.

Then one day, cleaning department discovered signs of dianoga in ships plumbing and waste system.

At first, they tried to kill it by dumping poison into the system, but soon it was obvious that something as simple as toxic substances aren’t going to do the deed, since this primitive organism turned out to be surprisingly resistant. As a next step they tried to squish it in isolated trash compactor but beying proved to be extremely flexible too as hydraulic press didn’t cause it any harm. After about a year of trying, as the last option, poor dianoga was lured into lower levels of ship and isolated, with crew hoping that it would eventualy starve and die. But soon, a different problem appeared.

Water reclaimers started to fail, pipes and canals got hopelessly cloged by waste in warious stages of rust and decay and minor fluctualions in main drainage canal’s flow got far more frequent than usual. All topped by biofilters using up way more toxin neutralizers than the amound from just a few weeks ago.

In the end, after another rutine budget meeting, cleaning department decided to free the dianoga from its isolation and let it roam through ship in order to lower maintenance costs, as the animals ability to chew through and digesting big scaps of trash turned out to be quite essential for smooth recyclation process. Department also came up with an idea of tracking dianoga’s whereabouts on the ship so it could be located at any time and efectively lured to cloged areas to chew them loose, should the need occure, which was prety much the every other day.

However, although there were quite many attempts to put a tracker on the beast, all of them eventualy failed. Some of them were more memorable than others, such as an attempt #15 where a group of technicians tried to use a rod in order to stab the tracker under dianoga’s skin - result: severely damaged garbage shutte and two technicians send to medbay for three days, one with a stab wound, the other with tracker stuck to his own leg. So far the most succesful attempt was the attempt #31 with tracker wrapped in several layers of anticorosive materials coated in sticky organic matter of unknown origin as a lure. Dianoga swalowed it whole as planed, but after aproximately an hour of functioning the signal was lost. It’s believed that digestive juices of beast coroded othervise uncorodable double enforced durasteel plating, which caused both awe and fear among technicians involved in construction of the device.

At this point, the topic of dianoga became an inner joke and public secret among non-military crew of Finalizer. Saying “it’s like putting a tracker on dianoga” was commonly heard, used to describe situations and plans which may sound reasonable at first but soon turn out to be impossible to acomplish.

Around the time of an attempt #28, dianoga became an unofficial mascot of Finalizer and a pet name pool was created. After a democratic vote during lunch break of Aurek shift, dianoga was nicknamed Kylie Ren. At first, members of Cresh shift protested against this as they were unable to vote since they were in the middle of their sleeping cycle at the time, but soon after resentments dissolved. In the end, name stuck thanks to the fact that dianoga and newly transfered knight had quite many things in common: both of them were a mystery of unknown origin, roamed the vesel on a daily basis without anyone seeing their faces, both were believed to be prety much indestructable and despite their outer appearance and behavior, both Rens prooved to be a useful addition to the crew.

When general Hux first heard about the whole dianoga case, he promptly left the bridge without explanation. Soon after, a pair of stormtroopers on a routine corridor partol reported unexplained sounds closely resembling maniacal laughter coming out of main conference room. Investigation of the sound origin was never opened.

Soon after, blueprints for tracker for attempt #34 started to circulate among ships technicians. Since no one signed them, two opposite rumors appeared. According to one, author of those blueprints was no one else but general Hux himself since as a part of its design, tracker contained a globular shield generator suspiciously similar to planetary shield of Starkiller, only of exponencialy smaller size, to repel digestive juices to save device from corosion. The other rumor says that exactly because of the reason above, author doesn’t wish to be known, as stealing construction plans of Starkillers shields and using them for something like this may be seen as a treason. Arguments were still ongoing when construction of the tracker began.

However, device was never finished. Kylie’s rotting corpse was discovered during manual mainainance after few unsuccesful attempts of luring her towards what was believed to be just another clog. Since she was a beloved pet, doctors from medbay offered to undergo an autopsy on her, but found no physical cause of Kylie’s unexpected death. In not-so-official report it was stated that “dianoga lost her will to live” and perished just like that.

This saddened many, but there was no time to mourn poor deceased creature, as Resistance started with their attacks. And so to save time and tears, Kylie was with no further ceremonies spaced like the rest of unrecycable waste just a moment before Finalizer jumped to hyperspace.

May the force be with you, Kylie.

The end.

May the force be with you, Kylie.

summary: you ever notice how all famous media is pretty much about child soldiers... star wars harry potter naruto any shonen anime ever...

star wars

harry potter

naruto

any shonen anime ever at all period

steven universe

i mean i can go on. but you get the point

blog.name: totallycorrectstarwarsquotes
blog.title: Totallycorrectstarwarsquotes
blog.description: | These are 110% real | I’m Star Wars Trash | Lots of Kylux | Talk to me about our disaster space gays | Asks and submissions are always open |

summary:
Kylo: I bet I could fit the whole galaxy in my hands!
Hux: I’m sorry, Ren, but that’s physically impossible-
Kylo, cupping Hux’s...
body:
Kylo: I bet I could fit the whole galaxy in my hands!

Hux: I’m sorry, Ren, but that’s physically impossible-

Kylo, cupping Hux’s face in his hands: Are you sure ?

Hux, blushing: Stop, I have a reputation.

reblog.comment:

Hux, blushing: Stop, I have a reputation.

summary: Things get steamy in the supply closet
title: Things get steamy in the supply closet
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2AFS1S4

by Art_and_Chaos

So this is my first piece of work on here, not gonna lie this is not the first fan fic or smut for that matter that I’ve written, but I am doubtful of it’s overall quality. However I hope you enjoy!

There isn’t much to explain about this fic, it’s a short smut I wrote for fun.

Words: 1295, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars Sequel Trilogy, Star Wars The Force Awakens, Star Wars
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/F

blog.name: optimisticsprinkles
blog.description: A crazy cat lady who loves hot tea, rainy days, and happy endings.

title: Interrogation Scene: Mind-Rape
body:
My own brother called the invasion of Rey’s mind by Kylo “mind-rape.” I’ve never seen it that way because of one simple thing: suspension of disbelief.

The term suspension of disbelief or willing suspension of disbelief has been defined as a willingness to suspend one’s critical faculties and believe something surreal; sacrifice of realism and logic for the sake of enjoyment. (Wikipedia)

Rape is a visceral idea, turning the stomach of any rational being. It is an act of sexual violence and violation. It’s extreme, it’s horrifying, and it immediately puts people off, which is something a Star Wars movie made by Disney would never in a million years do.

If mind-reading were real, yes, it would probably function as mind-rape.

But there is evidence in the movies that this is neither the intent nor the case for this power.

1. Rey uses it. No one would ever let the heroine return rape with rape.

2. Rey is neither traumatized by nor angry about the invasion of her mind. She is much more focused on hating Kylo because of Han, and she never shows indications of lasting effects from the mind-reading. She never seems to think of it again, in fact, and she certainly never brings it up in her list of grievances.

3. Mind-reading is a magic construct in a fantasy universe where the logic of real life doesn’t always apply. The creators make it obvious that mind-reading is uncomfortable or even painful but also that it doesn’t leave lasting psychological damage, so… I guess that’s how it is.

4. Kylo is clearly not meant to be the kind of character who would physically rape someone. He’s meant to be a sympathetic character, though evil. “You have too much of your father’s heart in you.”

5. The point of the interrogation for the plot was to awaken Rey’s powers and give her a glimpse into Kylo’s mind so she could pry a few techniques out of him. It was a plot device but not a plot point.

To accept that this power is invasive and physically painful but not mentally traumatizing requires a suspension of disbelief. It’s taking your logic, setting it aside, and accepting what the movie shows us without worrying about the real world implications.

It doesn’t mean we can’t consider those implications, or talk about them, but suspension of disbelief is what the movie is clearly relying on.
body_abstract:
My own brother called the invasion of Rey’s mind by Kylo “mind-rape.” I’ve never seen it that way because of one simple thing: suspension of disbelief.

The term suspension of disbelief or willing suspension of disbelief has been defined as a willingness to suspend one’s critical faculties and believe something surreal; sacrifice of realism and logic for the sake of enjoyment. (Wikipedia)

But there is evidence in the movies that this is neither the intent nor the case for this power.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina
